body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the northern part of Scotland:
examples: The Cairngorms National Park covers an area of 1,748 square miles in the council areas of Aberdeenshire, Moray, Highland, Angus, and Perth and Kinross.
The majority of the rocks within the Cairngorms National Park belong to the Dalradian Supergroup.
